title: Financial Ed and the Common Core
description: If students learn about personal finance in grade school, they’ll be more responsible spenders as adults. So goes the thinking […]
contentencoded:
If students learn about personal finance in grade school, they’ll be more responsible spenders as adults. So goes the thinking behind a move to embed personal finance lessons into classes kids already take, like English and math.


Guest: Dan Kadlec, Author and Journalist who writes frequently about personal finance for Time magazine and other publications.


Read Kadlec’s column about personal finance and the Common Core State Standards.
